newsitem.title: USA: Enlighten sees Q4 loss $0.07/shr on charge.
newsitem.headline: Enlighten sees Q4 loss $0.07/shr on charge.

text.p: Enlighten Software Solutions Inc on Wednesday said it expects to report a loss of about $200,000, or $0.07 a share, in the fourth quarter after accounting for a $200,000 one-time termination fee.

The fee, paid to former shareholders of Network Partners Inc, relieves Enlighten of future earn-out payments under a 1994 contract that dealt with the acquisition of monitoring technology from Network Partners, according to Enlighten.

In a statement, Enlighten said fourth quarter earnings before the termination fee would be about break-even, based on revenue of about $2.0 million. In 1995's fourth quarter, the company reported a loss of $0.35 a share, including charges, on revenue of just over $1.5 million.

Fourth quarter product license fees rose to a record of about $1.2 million, compared with $466,000 one year ago. Unix product new license revenues rose to about $460,000 in the fourth quarter versus $107,000 last year.

In the full year 1996, Enlighten expects revenues of roughly $6.4 million and a net loss (including the Network Partners termination agreement) of approximately $800,000 - $900,000, or $0.28 - $0.31 per share.
In addition, Enlighten named Mark Himelstein as vice president of engineering and chief technology officer and Ian Cartwright as managing director of European operations.
